title: Man suffers life-threatening injuries after plunging from balcony at Nottingham Trent University
text:
A 19-year-old man has fallen from a balcony of a Nottingham student halls and is in a life-threatening condition.

Police officers have taped off the Nottingham Trent halls in the city centre after the man was rushed to hospital after the fall at around 3.50am today.

A cordon has been put up in Hampden Street and officers remain at the scene.

A 19-year-old man has fallen from a balcony of a Nottingham student halls and is in a life-threatening condition

The second floor balcony area of Nottingham Trent University's Hampden student halls has also been taped off in a number of areas.

Hampden Street remains open and traffic is unaffected by the cordon which is located on the pavement area.

A Nottinghamshire Police spokesman said: 'A 19-year-old man has been taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries after falling from the balcony of a property in Nottingham.

'We were called to Hampden Street at 3.48am today.

Police officers have taped off the halls in the city centre after the man was rushed to hospital after the fall at around 3.50am today

Hampden Street (pictured) remains open and traffic is unaffected by the cordon which is located on the pavement area

'A scene has been set up while we continue with our enquiries.

'At this time we are not treating the incident as suspicious. The man's family has been informed.

'If anyone has any information about the incident we'd ask them to call Nottinghamshire Police on 101, quoting incident number 115 of 5 October 2019.'
description: Police officers have taped off the Nottingham Trent halls in the city centre after the man was rushed to hospital after the fall at around 3.50am today. Police are not treating the incident as suspicious.
